Literature Review: Ergothioneine, a diet-derived antioxidant, has garnered significant attention in recent years due to its unique properties and potential biological functions. This review aims to summarize the current state of knowledge on the biological roles of ergothioneine, with a focus on its antioxidant properties and its interaction with the OCTN1 transporter. The review will also explore the evidence for ergothioneine's anti-inflammatory and cytoprotective effects, as well as its potential role in protecting mitochondria from oxidative damage.
